snippet: An enormous Shell Oil offshore rig that had broken free and gone adrift in the Gulf of Alaska for the better part of three days was brought under control on Monday, the company said.
abstract: Enormous Shell Oil offshore rig that had broken free and gone adrift in Gulf of Alaska for  better part of three days is brought under control; two tow lines from rig named Kulluk, which had been used for test drilling in the Arctic, are reattached to support ships about 19 miles south of Kodiak Island; officials are discussing what steps to take next.
lead_paragraph: An enormous Shell Oil offshore rig that had broken free and gone adrift in the Gulf of Alaska for the better part of three days was brought under control on Monday, the company said.

headline.seo: Runaway Oil Rig Under Control, Shell Says
headline.main: Runaway Oil Rig Off Alaska Under Control, Shell Says
headline.print_headline: Runaway Oil Rig Off Alaska Under Control, Shell Says
